short_description: Generates the subsequences for the paths provided
long_description: This function takes as input a sequence stored in row and generates all subsequences. This input could come from the result of an nPath query or if the data is already stored in a sequence

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: The name of the table containing the input data.
input_tables.description: The name of the table containing the input data.

argument_clauses.name: SeqColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the paths.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the paths.

argument_clauses.name: Delimiter
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the single-character delimiter that separates symbols in the path string. The default value is comma (','). Note: Do not use any of the following characters as delimiter (they cause the function to fail): Asterisk (*), Plus (+), Left parenthesis ((), Right parenthesis ()), Single quotation mark ('), Escaped single quotation mark ('), Backslash ('')
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the single-character delimiter that separates symbols in the path string. The default value is comma (','). Note: Do not use any of the following characters as delimiter (they cause the function to fail): Asterisk (*), Plus (+), Left parenthesis ((), Right parenthesis ()), Single quotation mark ('), Escaped single quotation mark ('), Backslash ('')
